data.title: head> Additional Abel Gance Links
data.meta_description: Worlds Only Home Page for Abel Gance, Famous French film director
data.text:
Additional Links about Abel Gance, his films, techniques, inventions and people in his films...

In 1997, Boston Light and Sound provided the three special interlocked projectors for the triptych at Francis Ford Coppola's $1000 per plate dinner and showing of Napoleon.

Arthur Honegger wrote most of the music for Napoleon and several other Gance films (in French).

The Honegger info in English, translation courtesy of Google.com

Race Mathews on Napoleon from Australia.

A Gance bio and a scholarly review of Napoleon from Australia

Walter Percy Day played Admiral Hood in Napoleon and is credited with special effects. His site is sponsored by his grand-daughter, Susan DAY and maintained by my friend Luigi Durante

For more information about triptychs, visit Triptych Trailers

Allegedly Dead Media, Ian Campbell's site features working notes describing Gance's use of Polyvision.

European Silent Cinema Project

Taylorogy, with an interview of Gance by Louella Parsons, August 14, 1921(scroll down once you get there).

Gance's filmography from IMDB.

Gance's biography from IMDB.

Louise Brooks Society, another Silent Giant.

Rudolph Valentino's Home on the Web.
